reviews.review_msg: The best instructor I have ever had. Period.
The worst prof ever. I really don't want to see him again not in the course but also in any situation.

I'm sure he's a knowledgable guy and he's actually not that "mean" when you ask questions. But I definitely do not get his marking.. I failed two of my four assignments even though I spent so much time on it (I still got higher than the class ave for those two assignments somehow.. ).  The assignments was not even hard, but his marking was.
Worst "worst" prof I have ever met. He does not even listen to students outside the class or reply to emails. Extremely odd scaling where half of the class received D or below.
AVOID this professor as much as possible!!! He said half way when marking the midterms, he got grumpy. The lecture recordings should still prove of it in it. That is NOT FAIR.

One of the Best profs I ever had in my life. His knowledge in this field is so deep. I Thoroughly enjoyed every class.He expects more from his students, and always welcomes discussions. Exams were little bit tricky, marking and grading were harsh, but if you work hard you will get a good grade. If you enjoy learning and working hard,don't miss lou

He is absolutely the worst ever. No joke. One earlier rater said s/he was able to talk to the department head and got permission to retake the course with someone else. Now why didn't I do that? Fellow students: keep this bit of knowledge handy. You too can take control of the quality of your own education!!!
No Comments
Best computing prof I have ever had.  Lectures were very informative

This professor does not want you to do well in their class. It is the day before the final exam in this course, and I have no idea what my grade currently is, as we haven't received marks for most of the assignments and quizzes this semester. Answer keys are filled with mistakes, making it impossible to learn from them.
run while u can
Disorganized course, drop if you don't want an automatic fail
Amazing subject with most disorganized and outdated teacher yet. Skip it if not mandatory.
I've waited 3 semesters for a different professor for CMPT 371, and why in the world would SFU keep the worst professor in the same class for over 3 semesters?

Honestly, the absolute worst professor I've had at SFU. The midterms were so far from what we learned in class and we received zero practice material, even for the final. This would have been fine if the lecture slides made any sense. Also, we took 6 quizzes and never received any grades or feedback for them the entire term! Horrible experience.
The only plausible explanation I have as to why Janice is still teaching at SFU is that she must have the presidents nudes and is blackmailing her with them.

Assignments are full of mistakes and stuff not covered in lectures along with being released late. Tests are equally full of mistakes requiring fixes during the tests. Avoid at all costs. If you have to wait an additional term to graduate, do it. Absolute nightmare.

She's quite patient in answering questions but that's the only good thing. Her lectures (both the notes and actual presentation from her) are very disorganized as well as assignments and exams. She also put mandatory materials that SHE failed to cover in regular class time into extra videos and expect us to watch them in our own time.

Lectures were disorganized and she often put up mandatory tutorials, despite no real tutorial for the course; turning 3hrs of lecture per week turns into 5hrs because of incompetence. Every assignment and exam had at least one mistake which needed to be fixed. Overall this has been a terrible experience by a prof who seems to not care anymore.

She recycles old assignments and midterms every year and doesn't care they're always indecipherable and basically a grade school grammar test. Deciphering these ambiguous instructions takes AGES especially on midterms. Janice either knows her teaching awful and doesn't care, or is completely oblivious. Felt like I learned nothing useful.

The site that contains lecture recordings and notes is a big mess and very unorganized. - Some links doesn't work - Some recordings don't have audio / poorly executed presentation (wrong slides/screen, pointer missing, small screen, etc) - Most assignments are way more difficult and longer than the materials taught.

Class and lectures are poorly organized. The assignment is about things that she doesn't even teach yet. She gives a bonus for early assignment submission but she doesn't even have time to cover those topics in class. Mistakes in midterm questions, assignments, and solutions. No reply from TAs at all. Avoid her if possible.

Worst prof in the entire world, her final is more like a grammar test. You have to do the exact same way she told you. Such a cold heart prof. I was literally threatened by her when I try to review my final test with her.

Pretty bad experience. Lectures irrelevant to assignments and tests, but the textbook does not cover nearly enough for the quizzes. Felt well organized at first, with schedules and audio recordings available, but that quickly fell apart as the course went on. Was always slow to release assignments and grades.
Long and unclear lectures based on old power point presentations. I would never take any courses with this professor.
Hard course
The assignment documentation is looooooooong, and can be slightly confusing, too. The in-class quizzes are DEMANDING. On the other hand, she is extremly patient and helpful during office hours.

She is one of the best prof, super nice and super helpful. Ignore people who saying it's too much work because at the end you will end up learning a lot. I really like her, definitely take course with her. I am sure you will not regret. :) :D

She is very nice and super helpful. She is also very hard working. She gives you a lot of stuff to do but if you go to her office hours then she explains very well. I think she is of the nicest and hard working profs at sfu. People say she is bad because she gives a lot of work.

There's a lot of mistakes in her slides, and sometimes mistakes occur in her lectures, which is very confusing. Also, the assignments are not very close to her lecture. But the exam is easy and very close to the assignments and quizes.
Terrible prof! all she does is read slides in class, takes too long to give out grades and solutions to quizzes and assignments. Doesn't teach anything in class but gives harsh marks.

Although she is sometimes a bit unorganized (e.g.: forgets to put stuff up on the website in time), she's very friendly and willing to answer any and all questions. She has lots of office hours. Assignments are reasonable, but sometimes ambiguously worded. Exams involve lots of writing.
way too much work for this course. exams were fairly easy but quizes were just retarded. assignments were way too time consuming.

Encourages questions in class.  She speaks in a slow, comfortable pace... doesn't babbles on.  All PowerPoint notes, so she makes a lot of hand gestures in the air and doesn't write things down on the overhead... maybe difficult for some students to grasp material this way.  Very challenging assignments.  Fair midterm.  Very knowledgeable.

Good for 1 on 1 help if you go to her office hours, quizes weren't great and the assignments, midterms and finals were fair. 
 
 Lecture it's hard to understand her.
 
 One time a few people were watching a bee fly around the room and around her head. They were more intersted in the bee than lecture

To bad she can't keep anyone awake.  But she is really nice and willing to help.  Quizes suck but force you to try and stay awake. Don't bother with e-mails, she will never get back to you.  She always changes her notes after she gives them out, always have to double check printed copy with her copy

I don't know why so many are whining but she's excellent! she's enthusiastic about the ultra boring material and always smiling the quizez are a good idea cuz if everybody likcs at a quiz she goes over the material again. course is interesting but oh oh soooooo boring! Excellent teacher overall
dont take 371 if she teaches it...
terrible teacher
Your pillow will need a pillow
No Comments
I'll just say what they said is true.
spent 2/3 of her class talking about Physics! You will realize at the end that you just went through a Physics course!
NO COMMENT !!!
Boring
Very enthusiastic about the course material.  Sometimes comes across as disorganized.  Seems to get caught with details in the lectures at the expense of not conveying the concepts of the course.
boring as hell
Make a Computer course beome a Physic course, make everyone sleep. I count 90%+ sleeping/day dreaming
Ahh the course sucks and she makes it sooo much harder by giving long (i mean looong) assignments and who knows about the exams
Took 371 and 300 with Ryan. He's very engaging with his discussions and live demos. Definitely recommend for either or both of these courses!

Interesting/entertaining lectures. Randomly busts out kali and aircrack for live demos. Actually discusses slides rather than just reading them to you. Slides/textbook available online. Attendance not mandatory but definitely helpful. Not an easy grader but not a random trivia master either. Midterm/final stuck to the slides. 75% exam average

Very knowledgeable. Clear and organized lectures. Very fair assignments and grading. Easy to talk to and loves discussions and questions during class. I would certainly recommend him. He is a very calm, quiet and well spoken person which can make his lectures almost soothing and relaxing to listen to. This can be a problem if youre already tired.

He's a super nice guy, very knowledgeable and passionate about the material. 5 written assignments were fairly easy (24/30 average ish), midterm and final were fairly difficult (50 average ish) but they're scaled so you'll be fine. I missed a bunch of lectures but read every textbook chapter and got a B+. Read 10 pages a day and you're good to go!

He is nice but you just can't really focus on his lecture with his low, soft and deep voice reading the ppt in class... It always makes half class students fell asleep... Maybe Prof peters can change to other lecture style somedays...

I took this class because it was a pre-requisite for Distributed Systems and I wasn't necessarily expecting to be that interesting. However, I very much enjoyed this class. Dr. Peters is a fantastic lecturer, one of the best I've had at SFU, and he was helpful during office hours and after class. I learned a lot from this class.
The prof's level of interest in the subject is very high so you will get lots of tidbits that is real world compared to other classes.  Highly recommend him.
Great prof. Lectures were interesting, and he listens to students' suggestions
No Comments
His assignments are empty-hearted and exams are ill-fated.
Nice attitude. His lectures seems simple but assignments and exams are tough. you need to do a lot of research in order to do assignments. Final exam is killer.
He is a helpful and nice professor.

Very informative. Course itself can be dry, but comprehensible. Read textbooks to get more background knowledge. He is clear on what he expects on exams. Overall, I enjoyed his lectures and his programming assignments were interesting too. Defitely doable!

All the material is covered in his lectures and slides. Exams are based on the assignment and the projects are not very difficult. The prof is helpful and can always reply your emails very soon. A quite nice and interesting Chinese guy:) I'd love to take his courses in the future.

one of the best professors I have met. attending class is important since he will tell you  what will be covered in the exam . also, he is very glad to answer your questions and always replies your e-mail in 24 hours.
he's cute. anyway u never have 2 listen 2 his lectures, they r jus helpless. better spend time on the textbook and exams become so easy.

This class could be good.  Making JC teach it makes it horrible.  One of the worst profs I've had in my 4 years here.  He actually knows his material, but his assignments are so old that most people copy them, and his projects are useless and also mostly copied.  This means those of us who bust our asses to do it without cheating get penalized.

this prof is very smart,but he has hard time explain to students things himself understands well.And sometimes pronounce words wrong, like he pronounce "genuine" like "genius" .The exams are fair, but assignments and projects could be very time consuming I think if you r his graduate student, he will be more helpful.

Smart prof. but have a hard time explaining things. You're better off reading the book. Extremely easy assignments and relatively easy exam. You need not memorize or understand everything to pass. Though grading is low. Average and median grade of class is 85/86.
Beware - 80% overall = C-
Wonderful professor! You should choose his courses without any hesitation!

The midterm was too long and I wasn't even close to finished. He gave an assignment due 2 days before the final, and a group project due after all the final exams. He was fair on the final grade though. If you plan on taking him, just be careful of this poor scheduling.

Somehow I thought he was going to teach another easy class.  I had him for MACM 101 and it was fine.  For CMPT 371, for some reason the class was just so ridiculously hard.  His exams are nothing like questions in the book or asked on the assignment.  I want to cry from his final.
Very boring lectures. The class content was actually supposed to be interesting, but he made it exceptionally bland!
Unbelieveably easy!!!

Easy course. Prof is nice. True, he has an accent problem but since everything can be learnt from notes,  it doesn't really matter. Exam are based on assignments, midterm is a bit hard due to limited time, final is extremely easy.

exams were unexpected, too much reading. cmpt371 other prof covered up to ch 6 of the same book. we did up to ch 9 + another text book. exams not closely related to homework assignment questions. take with another prof.

Would avoid. Covers two textbooks which is over 1100 pages of material, gets flustered when people ask him what to study because there is so much material. Didn't learn anything, midterm very difficult.
He is useless. And never share notes with students. Midterm is really really hard.

Poor instructor abilities. Sounds like a recording (just tries to get the lecture out of the way so he can go back to research). Doesn't prepare you for his midtermsfinals - they hit you like a train when you have them. Assignment submission system he has is annoying (drop it on a folder an NFS, what happened to coursys?)

The worst thing about Gu is that he teaches two books, but doesn't clarify to study which chapters! you will be surprised by questions from never thought chapters in extremely difficult final exam.AVOID

Gu is reasonable, although his English makes it hard to understand him completely. Also, three-hour long lectures may put you to sleep. Nevertheless, he has very good notes and you may read the book/ use google groups. The assignments come from the book, which is somewhat confusing. If in doubt about the assignment questions go to Gu directly.

Sounds like Kermit the frog, but with HORRIBLE grammar + accent. His teaching was boring, and not helpful for the assigns. Lecture notes were very unclear, and did not even have the diagrams he used from the book. $160(new) so look for pdf or used copy. Final exam WTF it was outta the blue. Read the book and know the graphs well. Turn off your CELL

I was very excited about computer networking before I took this course with Mr.Gu. Well not anymore! While the book discusses some of the latest technologies, class discussions are monotonous, fast-paced and hard to follow. Even though some of the classes' finest minds were helping me understand the assignments, I found them to be quite hard.AVOID!
does not make class very interesting at all.  weak prof at best..

WORST prof. I have ever had at SFU. Had to complete and hand in homework before he even goes over the chapters for the assignment. Can't understand a single word coming out of his mouth, won't clarify questions on the exams (despite his atrocious grammar, which makes it hard to discern exactly *what* he wants us to answer.)  Avoid him at all costs.

Lecture notes are overly simplified that you could have ahard time understanding them. His English is sub-par at most, making him difficult to understand. Assignments are straight from book, but his solutions are not helpful and asking him would not help you. His midterms and (especially) final exam will have you go, "WTF?!".

Never take 371 with Gu. His lectures were horrible and his attitude sucks! For his lectures he memorized and read word for word from the textbook, no preperation. The assignment questions were also from the book and he managed to mark them unfairly without giving much explanation. Did not synthesize material. Gave no context. Two thumbs down!

Little difficult to understand his English sometimes; Assignments are straight from the book; His lecture notes are overly simplified and does not help most of the time, so lecture attendence is a must; You really got to read the book to understand what he is talking about in the lectures; His midterm and final are okay.

The professor just reads off the lecture slides and just throws a mass amount of new vocabulary at you. You're better off just reading and doing question from the textbook + watching the author's videos online, it's the same content. The mini-projects req a partner and was tough due to the limited instructions. I didn't feel like I learned much...

The professor is average at best, she spends time reading off lecture slides and you don't really learn much in class. The textbook author's videos on YouTube are a better watch along with the textbook questions and text itself. Mini-projects were kinda tough but there's only 2 of them. I just don't feel like I learned a lot in this class...
Really nice professor. Even tho her lectures may not be the best, she definitely is really caring and helpful. I would recommend.

My biggest advice is to do practice problems from the textbook. The networking textbook also comes with lectures on youtube that are very helpful to supplement learning. Ouldooz has her own set of yt vids too. Assignments are hard, but quizzes/exams are easy/medium difficulty.

It's a yawn fest to put it bluntly. Recycles all the materials from Kurose / Ross textbook and basically reads off them verbatim. Didn't even try to make this course more interesting. Requires minimum weekly input. Little programming required. Open book everything.

A lot of work to get an A, you need to remember a ton of specific details. 4 quizzes, a midterm, a final, 4 hw, a mini-project with partner, and 6 small wireshark assignments. That said if you put in the effort you can get a good grade. Reading the book was helpful but time consuming. Exams and quizzes are easy if you know your stuff. Caring prof.

Class was really organized. She listed everything on main page date by date including recommended and mandatory readings, practice questions and all other course related things. I highly recommend doing readings and putting time into homework. She also responds discussion questions and emails in very reasonable time frame.

Class was organized and grading was fair. Course materials were hard but she explained them clearly. Reading textbook also helped me understand this course. I highly recommend you take CMPT371 with Dr. Ouldooz Karimi. Negative comments about her in previous year did not match my impressions on her.
She is a good prof and knowledgeable. If you keep up with the class, you will get a good grade. She responds back to emails quickly if you have any questions. Organized class. I would recommend her

I don't understand the negative reviews here. In my experience prof was extremely organized. Her lectures were  alright and straight out of the textbook but slightly more abstract. If you do her readings before exams and submit assignments on time its very easy to get a reasonable grade that corresponds to the amount of effort you put in.

She's a very accomplished and intelligent network engineer. However, she tends to assume that students are also aware of her domain-specific knowledge and enterprise technologies. You must read the book, even if it is stated as recommended.

Lecture/Lecture notes are completely useless, don't bother studying them. Just study the textbook. Test/midterm questions are copy and paste/multiple-choice, but then she gave us only 75 minutes for 45 questions for the final. Exams, homework and lectures felt incredibly disconnected.

Her slides and lecture pre-recorded lecture videos are not informative. The content in them is very barebones, and expects the student to retain the information with just the slides. If you want to do well in this course, skip her lectures and read the textbook, and take notes from that instead of her slides. Midterm easy, final was difficult.
Lectures were dry and not explained in depth, you will need to read the textbook to get a real understanding. Quiz questions are worded poorly and not entirely related to lecture content.

Copy paste textbook questions, reword sentence structure and replace variable (abc) with (xyz) - plagiarism of the highest degree. Horrible pre-recorded lectures, made the content extremely dry and uninteresting. Reading the textbook by yourself is more engaging than listening to her speak. Profs like her do nothing but tank SFU CS' reputation.

Lectures are just reading definitions of network terms. Quizzes/Assignments are just copy-pasting textbook problems. Worst part is, she can't even do that right, as there are many times where she forgot to put the correct answer as a selectable option. Should've listened to the reviews, but how she is still teaching is beyond me.

This is an online class SERIOUS review. She posted 15 lecture videos / week for you to watch. The lecture video HAS A VERY LOUD EDM BACKGROUND while she is talking. Students dislike this very much and asked her to remove. Instead, she said RESEARCH SAYS IT IS GOOD TO HAVE BACKGROUND MUSIC. She doesnt remove it, and doesnt lower the volume. AVOID
Read the textbook and do all the practice questions in the end of the chapters.

Exam and midterm are like assignments, but she does not know how to gauge how much she is asking for in a question vs how much space and time is needed. Questions often have multiple parts or compare/contrast but only given a small space worth 10 marks. If you have test anxiety, slow writer do not take her! Says exam is 6-9 but only gives 90 mins
Literally all of her slides were just ripped from the textbook, you're basically paying tuition just to read the textbook.
The final exam was just a mess. Do not take with her. SFU better do something.

The final worth a huge chunk of our mark was decided in less time than the midterm... Unfair assignments, examinations, and notes/lectures of questionable quality. Take a course with this prof if you really need the credit, but other professors and the textbook are your best friend. SAD.
SHE IS VERY BAD INSTRUCTOR.

avoid at all cost. this prof does not know how to operate a course at all. project requirements are extremely ambiguous and vague. Final exam was 10 questions and 90 minutes. giving 9 minutes for each question when each question has multiple parts and requires a stupid amount of writing just doesnt make any sense!why does sfu even hire such a prof?

biweekly cumulative T/F, MC quiz w/ vague questions that are kinda true, kinda false. every assignment, project, exam question taken from google or textbook. announced 3h final was 90 minutes 3 days before final. student-sourced spellcheck. added unrealistic project requirements a few days before deadline. "it can't be that bad right?" it really is

It seems that she does want us to really explore the course material. However, she fails to give clear instructions, lectures, and materials. As the result, the course really put toll on students' time and efforts. I know that she improve teaching in time since she really does care about students learning, but for now it is best to avoid her class.
The projects are alot of work for little value to your overall mark, and the midterm destroyed everyone due to the incoherent lecture and quality of material we get.
Nice person but get ready to learn everything on your own...
I learned everything during the lectures and as others have said, shes caring and likes to help. responds really fast to her emails.

I am taking this course with her in summer 2019, and I gotta say that she is good. Her slides are amazing. Yes, it gets really hard to understand her, but I would totally take more classes with her. She cares alot about her students and wil not hesitate to re-answer questions for you.

Hardest prof I have ever meet. She is really bad at teaching. In her class, she only read the lecture but not explain the reason or give an example. She need you to read the textbook and the lecture notes for the exam which is really hard, tricky and come form details in the textbook. She has quiz that no one get full marks in class every two weeks

One of the worst lecturers in SFU. You might as well skip the lectures because she doesn't have public speaking skills (mumbling, stuttering, long awkward pause,...) Just read the book, you'll get more info from it than sitting in the 3 hrs long lecture with her. Other than that, her hw assignments and quizes are ok if you read the book.

Avoid. If you take a class with her, you're better off just reading the notes + textbook, and doing as many problems from the back of the book as possible instead of showing up to class. She does not provide clarification when homework instructions aren't clear. Quizzes are cumulative from ALL previous material. Spelling errors everywhere.
Worst prof I had at SFU. You have to learn most of the content yourself as her teaching is not helpful, just goes over the powerpoint slides.

Watch the videos from this guy called Jim Kurose, he has an entire playlist that is better than going to any lecture. No need to go to class if you want to learn. Although the prof seemed nice, the lectures just aren't good.

Entire class is practically just plagiarized from Jim Kurose, including all the slides. Homework assignments are all copy/pasted from other schools or textbooks. Exams are the same and contain content that has not been covered in class.

One of the laziest professors at SFU. Course materials patched from different schools, labs are blindly copy and pasting, no reasoning given for docked marks on exams/assignments, TAs ghost when asking for assignment feedback, exams contain material that were barely or not covered at all. Don't recommend.

Laziest prof I've ever encountered. His lectures are useless, he doesn't respond to emails, and his exams are so unrealistic given what he "covers" in class (this is true even if you do the readings).

What a brutal experience. Bob Gill is a great example of someone who puts no effort in. Don't take this class with him. I fully expect the final to be full of questions that were never taught just like the midterm. Sad.

No effort put into anything. Midterms cover topics not mentioned in slides or book. His lectures are not worth attending, and he makes passive aggressive comments about people not attending. Labs are "type the thing into terminal, report what you see". Assignments are just basic math, except with a networking theme, not actual networking problems.

Another student who's fair review was removed. To reiterate: he is the worst kind of professor. There is next to no effort put into student's learning and many midterms topics are never taught. Look at past midterms to do well, idk about the final. Don't go to class unless you are very passionate about the material.

It seems like the professor is reviewing all of them because my last review got removed. Shame. TL;DR: don't take this class if you actually want to learn, homework is copied from other schools, exams cover topics that haven't been taught, lectures go off topic a lot. At least he's funny though.

I appreciate his funny storytelling, but he has a hard time lecturing about relevant course material, making it tough to actually learn. His exams and assignments are confusing and difficult. I would wait for a better prof if you want to take the course.
Wonderful prof. Nothing wrong with him at all!

One of few teachers who used Industry examples relating to course material. This made learning better. One can see applications in daily life to understand better. Thanks - may be see you in 471. Wireshark learning was great.

Bob is knowledgeable in his field. He often jokes about his experiences, but oftentimes forgets that talking about something isn't teaching it. He often glosses over very important concepts and goes on side rambles, making it hard to know what we actually need to understand. Self learning (Jim Kurose YT videos) are more helpful than Bob's lectures.

While attendance is not mandatory but If you want to learn applications to industry yo should attend his lectures. Booking knowledge is not enough. Nice Video from AlcaTel Lucent - Dr. Gill. Made additional time to teach - Thank you. some students like me.

Most of his lecture didnt add much to the lecture notes if you took time to look through them yourself but it was his spirit and passion for what he teaches that kept me coming to his lectures! A genuinely nice and super easygoing person that obviously had a ton of experience/knowledge about the topic he was teaching. Love him!!

He's a nice guy but... Feels like about 50% of lecture is wasted on tangents and telling the same anecdotes repeatedly. PowerPoint jockey, glacial pace. Doesn't take time to understand student questions - just answers what he thinks is being asked. Misleading analogies. Avoid if you want to learn, but not the worst if you just need the credit.

Information is kind of just thrown at you and not much practice. Many assignment questions covering concepts not discussed in lecture... meant to "inspire you to do your own research". Quizzes are random bits and pieces from lecture. Shervin's nice but you're pretty much on your own; anticipate this being a memorization course.
Good professor

The course was well-structured and the professor was kind and helpful. However, the TA support was lacking—especially Jeril, who often deducted marks unfairly on quizzes and the project. Clearer grading guidelines and more consistent evaluation would have improved the experience.
Great lectures, difficult quizzes, fair assignments and examinations, very good professor to take for 371

His lectures are great and I definitely learned a lot. He posts lecture recordings too which is great. There is a socket programming group project. Can't recommend him for CMPT 272, but for 371, he is your guy.
he gave me A+ so im happy w it

Lecutres were amazing, I simply attended them to ask more questions about the subject. He does not rush through them and takes his time to make sure everyone's on the same page. Exams were very fair, the group project was fun to build. Goated prof overall.

Night and day from 272. Shervin was extremely knowledgeable in this class, and as a result I learned the most in a single CS course so far. Invites questions and spends time re-explaining course concepts when needed. Quizzes are tough, but the exams are more than fair. If you pay attention and work hard, it will be quite rewarding.

Dont know why reviews are so low for 371, the only thing difficult in this course is the first few weeks and the quizzes since they are a time crunch. Otherwise hes a very good prof and is very knowledgeable for this course, workload not high and exams are very fair.

I once was a Shervin hater. I had failed CMPT 272 and never mastered the ability to create HTML forms and fix 2006 era websites, however Shervin swooped in and changed me with his love of Networking and incredible explanations of TCP congestion control. Packets may be lost, but my love for Shervin will never be lost again.
only advice : RUNNNNNNNNNNNN
Good lectures, and records them too which is nice.
Horrible marking.
Good at lecturing, overall a good professor.
Had to drop, He is not that great.

No doubt the professor gives very good lectures But honestly do not take the class with him if youre trying to score a good grade. his assignments are never from the lectures, completely different questions than what you study in class. he does not give you any practice questions according to what he sets the exams. Brought my gpa down. AVOID HIM!!

The quizzes/exams would sometimes have questions based on information provided IN LECTURES (prerecorded lectures are not sufficient) with often a time crunch. Assignments are fairly difficult and you would need to contact TA or read the text for more information on it. Choose your partners wisely for project as it could be a huge time sink. GL!

A remarkable professor, he listens attentively, excels in teaching, and sets demanding exams. The course mandates external reading, fostering deep understanding and broadening students' knowledge. Exams challenge cognition with unique questions.

Amazing professor, clear and easy to understand explanations. Has a good sense of humor which makes lectures easier to get through. Quizzes/homework/exams are difficult, but you learn a lot from his class if you put in the work.
Insanely hard prof, puts unrelated content on all the quizzes and the final exam. Try to avoid at all costs!!!!
my question about this class is that what he was exactly thinking when making those assignments and quizzes.
The prof himself gives good lectures, but quizzes were extremely unfair. Assignments were OK, but there is nothing provided in class or materials that prepare you for them. Midterm was ok.

Lectures only cover basic concepts, but his assignments are completely unrelated and will make you bang your head against the wall for hours and hours. Quizzes are extremely difficult and have a time crunch as well. This course has assignment, quizzes, a project, a midterm and a final.

Assignments are not related at all to whatever his lectures. High course load, the course has quizzes, midterm, assignments, project, and a final well basically everything ... his lecture notes are empty as desert. Avoid him at all costs
SIMPLY THE GOAT. KOBE IN THE 4th. CR7 IN THE CHAMPIONS LEAGUE. IEEE FELLOW GOAT.

I had a great time with him. His lectures are very clear and to the point, and has great explanations and answers to all questions we ask him. Quizzes and exams are fair. The assignments are quite hard since the assignments are different from the lecture topics but you can read the textbook and find the information from there. Highly recommended.

well, she is one of my favorite teacher. her notes are clear and well organized. read all the notes will guarantee u a c+ or higher. listening to her lectures and take her side notes will get an easy A!!
If you would like to actually learn, and be in a good class then take this course with her!

Great professor. You follow the slides, and listen in class you should be have a decent mark. If you ever have questions or problems, she is very kind and will help you out. She understands the situations students are in, and keeps that in mind when it comes to assignments or exams. I highly recommend her, unless you want to do programming!

Her assignments and exam are fair, but her attitudes during class are excellent. her teaching is clear. she ll teach u more if u ask her during her office hour. she makes me feel the course is interesting and fun. ofcourse, u still have to work hard and think hard to get a high mark

Best professor ever! She is inspiring when she teaches her subject. She is a very nice person, who cares about her students. She's also a fair marker. I only wish she also taught Networking II. As it is, the choices for that course are not great.

Doesn't practice slides. Lazy, skips through difficult parts. Often has no clue what she is talking about, dodges all difficult questions that students ask. May be easy but you won't learn anything in her class.

I enjoyed Funda's class, she's got a great sense of humour. Assignments and tests are both fair, imo (plus the class is always curved). Teaches from textbook-based slides that are posted online. My only gripes are that she can be a tad disorganized and her wording on assignments can be vague at times.

This prof is very *VERY* unorganized. On assignments she'll ask you questions she hasn't taught. Flies over slides in lecture. Sometimes skips them because she has no idea what they mean (she hasn't done her slides...). Will test you on stuff she hasn't talked about in class. Is often late, cancelled 2 classes for personal reasons.

A prof whose exams seem extremely hard, but at the end of the day, she marks very fair and really tests if you know what you're doing or not.  I didn't much like the popup quizes, aka attendance checks, but i guess that's her choice.  Assignments were doable and marked easily.

dun wanna comment on how she teach, i think just so-so...  i got all assignments perfect... mt on avg... but end up got a D... thx to her tricky, non-sense final... u will see questions u dont know how to answer at all even with ur book opened

An excellent teacher to take 371 with.  I have no idea why people complain about her using the powerpoint slides that come with the textbook, they're good slides! I much happier that she used them then tried making up her own material.  Her explanations aren't always clear but if you ask her to work through an example you'll get what she means.

Lectures consist of reading slides aloud. Questions are encouraged but she answers unclearly and it doesn't seem to me like she knows what she is talking about. Not recommended, better get a networking book.

she is not quite up-to-date, but knows the course content well enough to teach it. you can do just as well by reading the textbook alone, although her explanations help, but they're just so long and windy...

Very nice and knowledable prof.  Will take the time (sometimes too long) to explain the finer details, and always (and I do mean always) checks to see if there are questions.  Only major complaint is that 99% of the class was her reading power point notes (which she said at the beginning of the term she wouldn't do).  Otherwise, very good prof.
No Comments
Great prof. Very kind and explains in detail. We did bad in the midterms so he made the finals easier. Approachable and always ready to help.

Gives one of the best lectures I've ever seen. Explains things in great depth, giving out examples and ensures students understand the content well. Networking may be a confusing topic at first, but Hefeeda explains it extremely well.

Lecture slides are shallow overviews with no explanations. He doesn't do a good job explaining the course material. Assignments/projects are impossible but everyone googles the answers. You learn more by reading the textbook.  Course itself sounded interesting but turned out boring. Would not recommend this prof.
Follows the textbook very closely. You need to read the text book, and then read it again, and you will do well. Attend lectures, because he will give explicit notes of what is on the exam.

He kept the class really interesting. He tried hard to make the material more approachable to students and gave extensions whenever needed to help everyone get a better understanding of the course. However, he isn't a great teacher and skims over the material during the lecture. It's not a big deal, since the course follows the book very closely!
